title: Alan Shearer and Martin Keown concerned by Marcus Rashford's form for Manchester United
text:
Alan Shearer and Martin Keown have expressed their sympathies for Marcus Rashford after the Manchester United forward extended his bad run of form in Sunday afternoon's defeat at Newcastle.

The 21-year-old has been a source of frustration for United fans this season, having endured a dry spell in front of goal for Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's side.

But Shearer and Keown have leaped to the defence of the England international, pointing to the lack of service as the reason for his bad spell.

Marcus Rashford has been a source of frustration for Manchester United fans this season

Former Arsenal defender Keown said: 'They start playing balls long into Rashford. I feel sorry for him, he’s surviving on scraps.

'I think he’s starting to despair in what’s around him. He’s [Rashford] not moving.'

Referring to a chance in the game that the United striker didn't capitalise on, Keown said: 'I don’t want to have a go at him because I think he’s a magnificent player but I don’t know what he’s waiting for there.

'He’s not getting the service. It’s the combination of the two. It’s very predictable and all too slow.'

Martin Keown expressed concern for the striker, saying he is not getting the right service

Alan Shearer said that the poor quality of the United side is having a detrimental effect on him

Shearer also weighed in on the Rashford debate, noting that the poor quality of the players around him is having a detrimental effect on the young striker.

'This is the worst Man United team I’ve seen for a number of years,' Shearer said. 'I wonder whether anything is actually saying anything to him [Rashford]. [He's] not moving in the box. He’s making it far too easy for defenders.

'It has to be a very frustrating time for him because that team is awful.'

Rashford will now go away with the England squad and hope that time with his national side will have a positive effect on his performances.
